intro: Ammannia elongata, commonly known as prairie oxypleura, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, preferring moist to wet soil conditions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ammannia elongata produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
